headline.print_headline: New Documents Show Legal Basis for NSA Surveillance Programs
headline.main: New Documents Show Legal Basis for NSA Surveillance Programs

docs.snippet: Documents released by the U.S. government show it views an executive order issued in 1981 as the basis of most of the National Security Agency's surveillance activities, the American Civil Liberties Union said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Documents released by the U.S. government show it views an executive order issued in 1981 as the basis of most of the National Security Agency's surveillance activities, the American Civil Liberties Union said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Cardiff Owner Tan Wants Slade to Outlast Long-Serving Wenger
headline.main: Cardiff Owner Tan Wants Slade to Outlast Long-Serving Wenger

docs.snippet: Cardiff City owner Vincent Tan wants to appoint Leyton Orient boss Russell Slade as manager in the hope he can usher in a new era of stability at the Welsh side and beat Arsene Wenger's long-service record at Arsenal....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cardiff City owner Vincent Tan wants to appoint Leyton Orient boss Russell Slade as manager in the hope he can usher in a new era of stability at the Welsh side and beat Arsene Wenger's long-service record at Arsenal.

headline.print_headline: Conservation Groups Oppose Wyoming Wolf Management
headline.main: Conservation Groups Oppose Wyoming Wolf Management

docs.snippet: Conservation groups are urging a federal judge not to allow the state of Wyoming to regain control of wolves....
docs.lead_paragraph: Conservation groups are urging a federal judge not to allow the state of Wyoming to regain control of wolves.

headline.print_headline: Bank of America Paying $7.65M to Resolve Inquiry
headline.main: Bank of America Paying $7.65M to Resolve Inquiry

docs.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission says Bank of America will pay $7.65 million to settle allegations that it overstated how much capital it had on its books....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission says Bank of America will pay $7.65 million to settle allegations that it overstated how much capital it had on its books.

headline.print_headline: Stumbling Bilbao Seeking Champions League Boost
headline.main: Stumbling Bilbao Seeking Champions League Boost

docs.snippet: When Athletic Bilbao fought back from a goal down to beat Napoli 3-1 in late August and book a place in the Champions League group stage the celebrations at their San Mames stadium suggested good times were about to roll....
docs.lead_paragraph: When Athletic Bilbao fought back from a goal down to beat Napoli 3-1 in late August and book a place in the Champions League group stage the celebrations at their San Mames stadium suggested good times were about to roll.

headline.print_headline: Ford Says It Will Reach Global Sales of 9.4 Million Vehicles by 2020
headline.main: Ford Says It Will Reach Global Sales of 9.4 Million Vehicles by 2020

docs.snippet: Ford Motor Co will increase its global sales to 9.4 million vehicles by 2020 from 6.2 million vehicles in 2013, said Jim Farley, Ford's sales chief....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ford Motor Co will increase its global sales to 9.4 million vehicles by 2020 from 6.2 million vehicles in 2013, said Jim Farley, Ford's sales chief.

headline.print_headline: 'Children of a Lesser God' Heads to Broadway
headline.main: 'Children of a Lesser God' Heads to Broadway

docs.snippet: The romantic story "Children of a Lesser God," which has been a hit already onstage and on film, is heading back to Broadway....
docs.lead_paragraph: The romantic story "Children of a Lesser God," which has been a hit already onstage and on film, is heading back to Broadway.

headline.print_headline: Court-Ordered Anti-Smoking Ads Challenged by Firms
headline.main: Court-Ordered Anti-Smoking Ads Challenged by Firms

docs.snippet: The nation's largest tobacco companies are challenging court-ordered advertisements requiring the cigarette makers to say they lied about the dangers of smoking....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's largest tobacco companies are challenging court-ordered advertisements requiring the cigarette makers to say they lied about the dangers of smoking.

headline.print_headline: Colorado, CDC Probing 10 Cases of Virus-Related Paralysis in Kids
headline.main: Colorado, CDC Probing 10 Cases of Virus-Related Paralysis in Kids

docs.snippet: U.S. health officials are investigating at least 10 cases of children in Colorado who developed limb weakness or paralysis after testing positive for a respiratory virus, state health officials said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health officials are investigating at least 10 cases of children in Colorado who developed limb weakness or paralysis after testing positive for a respiratory virus, state health officials said on Monday.
